title: Acclaimed British writer Martin Amis dies aged 73
description: The celebrated novelist died at home in Florida after a bout with oesophageal cancer, his wife says.

title: Quad countries make thinly veiled swipe at China
description: Leaders of Australia, India, Japan and the United States issue a statement calling for stability in Indo-Pacific region.

title: Manchester City win third successive English Premier League title
description: City were confirmed as champions for the fifth time in six seasons after rivals Arsenal lost 1-0 to Nottingham Forest.

title: Floods displace more than 36,000 residents in northeast Italy
description: Deadly floods caused more than 305 landslides and damaged or closed more than 500 roads in the Emilia-Romagna region.

title: The battle for Ukraine’s Bakhmut: A timeline
description: Wagner claims control of Bakhmut but Kyiv says battles continue. Here are some key moments in the fight for the city.

title: Will the US default on its debt?
description: Republicans and Democrats in standoff over debt ceiling days before deadline.

title: Russia’s Prigozhin claims complete control of Ukraine’s Bakhmut
description: Ukraine rejects claim, says heavy fighting continues in the city and describes the situation there as 'critical'.

title: Zelenskyy goes on diplomatic blitz to tighten screws on Russia
description: Ukraine leader's visit to Hiroshima thrust the G7's efforts to choke Russia's economy to the top of a busy agenda.

title: Greece recovers hundreds of looted artefacts
description: Trove of 351 objects repatriated including a second-century bronze statue of Alexander the Great.

title: Sudan cannot afford to reject foreign help
description: This is not the time to indulge in anti-humanitarian rhetoric and condemn foreign aid in the name of anti-colonialism.

title: USAID chief says committed to helping Sudanese refugees
description: Al Jazeera spoke with USAID chief who announced $100m for Sudan and countries hosting displaced Sudanese refugees.

title: Khartoum’s outskirts attacked as Sudan war enters sixth week
description: Southern Omdurman and Khartoum North hit by artillery as sporadic gunfire reverberates, witnesses say.

title: Erdogan’s media domination and the vote in Turkey
description: Erdogan's media presence helps him take a tightly fought election to a run-off. Plus, media and the Sino-America divide.

title: Russia: Giving F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine a ‘colossal risk’
description: Western nations 'still adhering to escalation scenario' that risks widening the Ukraine war in Europe, official says.

title: G7 urges China to ‘play by the rules’ citing ‘economic coercion’
description: Western officials are becoming increasingly vocal about Beijing’s use of trade restrictions in political disputes.

title: Why does the G7 summit have 16 seats at the table?
description: Japanese PM Kishida has expanded the G7's guest list as he seeks to boost ties with middle-power countries.

title: Prominent Indigenous Australian journalist quits over racism
description: Stan Grant cites 'relentless racial filth' he endured after he raised colonial persecution of Indigenous Australians.

title: Arsene Wenger: A lifetime commitment to football
description: The legendary football coach discusses the successes and sacrifices he made in his career.

title: ‘Give sorrow words’: G7 leaders reflect at Hiroshima bomb museum
description: The horror of nuclear war has been highlighted by world leaders attending the G7 summit in Hiroshima, Japan.

title: ‘Day of joy’ as Griner makes WNBA return after Russia ordeal
description: Brittney Griner was released from a Russian penal colony in a high-profile prisoner exchange with the US late last year.

title: How will Turkey’s presidential run-off shape the economy?
description: Soaring inflation and a plunging lira will be top priorities for whoever wins the presidential run-off on May 28.

title: New film chronicles century-old Osage Nation murders
description: Director Martin Scorsese explores infamous spate of US killings driven by a quest to usurp Indigenous resource rights.

title: NFL great and civil rights activist Jim Brown dies aged 87
description: The legendary Cleveland Browns running back turned a starring role in the NFL into a long run as an actor and activist.

title: ICC war crimes prosecutor ‘wanted’ in Russia over Putin warrant
description: International Criminal Court prosecutor Karim Khan is wanted for arrest in Russia over war crimes charges against Putin.

title: Zelenskyy attendance at G7 confirmed, set to meet Japan’s Kishida
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will hold a bilateral meeting with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida at the G7.

title: Zelenskky hails Biden’s decision on F-16 jet training for Ukraine
description: Training Ukrainian pilots on US-made F-16 fighter jets will 'greatly enhance our army in the sky': Ukraine President.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 451
description: As the war enters its 451st day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Mexican government sends marines to take over private rail line
description: The administration of President López Obrador has promised to compensate the company for the rail line's use.
